Subject: [neat] Re: historical marking
 
=

=C2=A0 


The historical markings, also called innovation numbers, are com=
puted simply by a counter.  Every time a new gene appears through a complex=
ifying mutation, the historical marking counter for that type of gene is in=
cremented by 1.  For example, if it is a connection gene, then the connecti=
on gene counter is incremented by 1.  When genes are inherited from parents=
 by their offspring, their historical markings never change.  Therefore, th=
e origin of every gene is permanently recorded by the historical marking.

=
ken

--- In neat@yahoogroups.com, hojjat kaveh <kaveh_hojjat@...> wrote:
>
=
> hi,I'm sot of new to NEAT, and I wanted to know how "historical marking" =
is computed? what's the algorithm or formula?
> I got this implementation, =
but I couldn't understand the code?
> 
> =C2=A0
> TTL
>

iv><br>
<br>
The historical markings, also called innovation numbers, are c=
omputed simply by a counter.  Every time a new gene appears through a compl=
exifying mutation, the historical marking counter for that type of gene is =
incremented by 1.  For example, if it is a connection gene, then the connec=
tion gene counter is incremented by 1.  When genes are inherited from paren=
ts by their offspring, their historical markings never change.  Therefore, =
the origin of every gene is permanently recorded by the historical marking.=
<br>
<br>
ken<br>
<br>
